creator: roku@apache.org
text:
Save+Exit in BXE often causes an error like this:

0 HTTP/1.1 302 Moved Temporarily Date: Wed, 24 Mar 2004 14:59:30 GMT Server:
Jetty/4.2.19 (Linux/2.4.21-199-athlon i386 java/1.4.2) X-Cocoon-Version:
2.1.5-dev Transfer-Encoding: chunked Location:
http://127.0.0.1:8888/default/authoring/index.html 0

It takes 1 minute or so before save+exit returns the above error or at all.

I tried to hunt this down, without success up to now.
*** Bug 27906 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
creator: roku@apache.org
roku@apache.org
text:
With tomcat I have no problem using bxe.

I also tried Jetty again with various cocoon versions on different machines, but
I can not get jetty working with bxe and lenya.

creator: gregor@apache.org
text:
lenya redirects to 

http://127.0.0.1:8888/default/authoring/index.html?lenya.usecase=checkin&lenya.step=checkin&backup=true

after a save & exit in bxe. sometimes, this checkin seems to time out, resulting
in http headers showing up in the body:

0 HTTP/1.1 302 Moved Temporarily Date: Fri, 21 May 2004 12:30:20 GMT Server:
Jetty/4.2.19 (Windows XP/5.1 x86 java/1.4.1_01) X-Cocoon-Version: 2.1.4
Transfer-Encoding: chunked Location:
http://127.0.0.1:8888/default/authoring/index.html 0 

a view source shows the correct html though.

creator: roku@apache.org
text: IMO this should be scheduled for 1.2 even if we can not fix it.

creator: roku@apache.org
text:
While rolling 1.2 RC4,5,6 I also could reproduce the same beahviour using
kupu+save+exit.

I used Jetty on Linux.

A remark to the timeout problem with Kupu or BXE.
First of all it seems that it works arbitrarily.
Sometimes just fine and mostly a timeout and the content file is
empty leaving the tags I posted before. 

But now it comes:
When I edited content and have a timeout and klick back to the
authoring mode and see a "empty" content document and now klick again
editing with Kupu, the content is suddenly back again WITH the changes made
before. 

Hope it helps analyzing the problem.

Greeings
Christian
